alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 10:42AM EDT until March 28 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Upson, Talbot, Taylor and Crawford Counties. Flint River near Griffin affecting Spalding and Fayette Counties. Flint River near Thomaston affecting Upson and Talbot Counties. Flint River at GA 26 near Montezuma affecting Macon, Sumter and Dooly Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 12.3 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EDT Tuesday was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 4.8 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
